paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant G648S, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Long QT syndrome (LQT2) with QTc >500 ms

individual_records.phenotype_details: Multiple syncopal events, prolonged QTc >500 ms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 42-year-old female patient who presented with multiple past syncopal events related to polymorphic ventricular tachycardia (VT) and a corrected QT interval (QTc) that was consistently >500 ms.
Two of her 3 children, a 12-year-old male... were subsequently diagnosed with long QT syndrome (LQTS) following electrocardiographic cascade screening, which revealed a QTc >500 ms in both.
Two of her 3 children, an 11-year-old female... were subsequently diagnosed with long QT syndrome (LQTS) following electrocardiographic cascade screening, which revealed a QTc >500 ms in both.
The third child, a 14-year-old female, was found to be genetically negative, with a normal QTc.

functional_data.summary: The variant is absent from the control series in the Exome Aggregation Consortium, and the co-segregation with the phenotype in the family supports its pathogenicity.

variants.segregation_data: The variant co-segregates with the phenotype in the family.
variants.population_frequency: Absent from the control series in the Exome Aggregation Consortium.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence (American College of Medical Genetics criteria PP1, PP3, PP4, PM4)
variants.additional_notes: The variant has been previously reported in the setting of LQT2.
key_quotes: The familial variant had been previously reported in the setting of LQT2 in a compendium publication.
The variant is absent from the control series in the Exome Aggregation Consortium, and the co-segregation with the phenotype in the family supports its pathogenicity.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
